210020-d-01-24-09-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT H51EX-24 CALLED FOR SNOWPLOW SERVICE AT DRAKE ND. OPERATING ENGINES CP5926, SOO4423, SOO2016, SOO4435 AND SOO2010 CAME INTO CONTACT WITH A LARGE SNOWDRIFT AT A RATE OF 33 MPH. IT IS BELIEVED THAT THE SNOW PACKED UNDER THE PLOW LIFTING IT OFF THE RAILS. THE SNOWPLOW (SOO900182) ALONG WITHENGINES CP 5926 AND SOO 4423 ALL DERAILED.  THE ENGINE SOO2016 HAD THE FRONT TRUCKS DERAILED AND THEREAR TRUCKS STILL ON THE RAIL. THE TRAIN CREW WAS UNINJURED HOWEVER, MAINTENANCE FOREMAN WAS IN THEPLOW AT THE TIME OF IMPACT AND RECEIVED A SMALL GASH ON HIS FOREHEAD AND A BUMP ON THE HEAD. THE INJURED EMPLOYEE WAS TAKEN TO HOSPITAL IN MINOT WHERE HE WAS TREATED AND RELEASED.

012009-d-01-22-09-TSU.Narrative: TSU LOCOMOTIVE #108 AND FIVE TRAILING LOADED HOPPER CARS ROUNDED A CURVE HEADING SOUTH TOWARDS SAPULPA.  A RAILROAD CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE AND HELPER WERE WORKING ON THE RAILROAD AND HAND A BACK HOE ON THE TRACK UNPROTECTED BY WARNING FLAGS TO NOTIFY THE TRAIN CREW THEY WERE WORKING IN THIS AREA.  THECONTRACTOR EMPLOYEES HAD ALSO FAILED TO COMMUNICATE BY CELL PHONE TO THE TRAIN CREW THEY WERE WORKING ON THE TRACKS AND FOULING THE OPERATING AREA.  THE TRAIN ENGINEER, WHEN HE SAW THEM, MAKE AN EMERGENCY BRAKING ACTION RESULTING IN THE LOCOMOTIVE DERAILING BUT HE WAS NOT ABLE TO STOP BEFORE FRONT OF LOCOMOTIVE STRUCK THE BACKHOE SITTING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE TRACKS.  DAMAGE TO BRAKE RIGGING AND FRONT END SHEET OCCURRED TO LOCOMOTIVE AS A RESULT OF STRIKING THE BACK HOE AND TRACK DAMAGE OCCURREDUNDER THE LOCOMOTIVE.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO TRAIN CREW OR CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE.
